title: What are points and miles?
excerpt: A plain-language primer on the loyalty currencies you can earn, transfer, and redeem for travel.
seoTitle: What Are Points and Miles? | Miles Go Round
seoDescription: Understand the loyalty currencies behind award travel—how they work, why they matter, and where they come from.

sections.heading: What counts as a loyalty currency?
body: Airlines, hotels, and banks issue their own currencies that you can collect through flights, stays, and credit card spend.
Some currencies are locked to a brand, while others are transferable and can be moved to multiple partners for flexibility.

sections.heading: Why do programs issue them?
body: Loyalty programs reward repeat business and gather insights about customer preferences, which is why they offer incentives to keep you active.
When you redeem for travel, partners reimburse each other behind the scenes, letting you access outsized value compared to cash prices.

title: Ways to earn points and miles
excerpt: From welcome bonuses to shopping portals, here are the most reliable ways to build balances without overspending.

sections.heading: Leverage credit card bonuses
body: Welcome offers provide the fastest boost when you meet minimum spend responsibly and on time.
Pair the right card with your everyday categories—dining, groceries, travel—to earn multipliers without changing your habits.

sections.heading: Layer on program bonuses
body: Airlines and hotels run regular promos for elite members, co-branded cardholders, or stays at select properties.
Stack portal payouts, in-store offers, and dining rewards to keep balances growing even when you are not on the road.

title: Redeeming miles for flights and hotels
excerpt: How to spot high-value redemptions, compare cash prices, and avoid unnecessary fees when booking awards.
seoDescription: A practical guide to booking award flights and hotel nights without wasting points or paying surprise surcharges.

sections.heading: Check cash versus points
body: Always compare the cash rate to the award cost so you only burn points when they beat your personal value per point.
Factor in taxes, resort fees, and carrier-imposed surcharges, which can make some awards look better than they are.

sections.heading: Use partners to your advantage
body: Alliance and hotel partnerships often unlock routes and properties that are cheaper than booking with the primary brand.
Search flexible dates, nearby airports, and mixed-cabin itineraries to surface extra award seats.

title: How points transfer partners work
excerpt: Understand transfer ratios, timing, and bonus windows so you know when to move bank points to airlines or hotels.
seoTitle: How Points Transfer Partners Work | Miles Go Round

sections.heading: Know your ratios and pools
body: Each bank program sets its own transfer ratios, and some allow household pooling while others only let you move points between your own accounts.
Keep a simple note with your best 1:1 options, slower partners, and any quirks like expiring bonuses.

sections.heading: Time transfers carefully
body: Most transfers are irreversible, so confirm award space before you send points to a partner.
Watch for limited-time transfer bonuses, but balance them against schedule risk and the possibility of award space disappearing.
